intro: Gnaphalium gymnocomum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium gymnocomum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
